Coverage for any damage or theft of vehicles rented from ride-sharing companies.Extra card. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 10â‚¬ through your N26 app (available in Germany, Spain, Austria, Italy). If youâ€™re an N26 You customer, or if you want to upgrade to N26 You, youâ€™ll have the possibility to choose one of our five new colors when ordering a new card: Keep these in mind when consideringÂ N26 You(new tab):The N26 You Mastercard has no embossing: the card details, including the number, CVV code, and 10-digit token are printed on the back.If you upgrade to N26 You, the monthly fee of â‚¬9,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade. If youâ€™re a new customer, the first fee will be deducted 15 days after you prove your identity. From then on, youâ€™ll be charged your monthly fee on your sign-up date. Meaning that, if you opened your account at the end of the month, the first two  monthly fees will be charged the following month.The minimum membership is one year. Your contract automatically renews if you donâ€™t cancel your membership at least 4 weeks before the contract expires.*Allianz Global Assistance Europe trade name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and member of the Allianz Group.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to Metal?
content: â„¹ï¸Â Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein.N26 Metal is available during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you already have a N26 bank account or a N26 You membership. To upgrade to N26 Metal from the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 Metal. and choose between a Charcoal Black, Quartz Rose, or Slate Grey card.Check the conditions of theÂ delivery and accept the N26 MetalÂ T&Cs(new tab). Once you confirm your request by entering yourÂ Confirmation PIN, your new card will be on the way.Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days.The membership fee of â‚¬16,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 Metal membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends.All purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.If youâ€™re already a N26 You member, you donâ€™t have to pay the fees for the N26 You membership on top.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14â‚¬ through your N26 app. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to upgrade to N26 You?
content: â„¹ï¸Â Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Poland, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden.You can upgrade to N26 YouÂ during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you have a standard N26 bank account. To upgrade to N26 You in the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 You. You can choose between one of our five new colours when ordering a new card: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate.Then choose your preferred delivery method, accept the N26 You T&C's(new tab) and your new card will be on the way. Standard deliveries take up to 10 business days whereas express deliveries take 3 business days. The membership fee of â‚¬9,90 will be deducted directly from your account every month on the date of your upgrade.The minimum contract period for the N26 You membership is one year. Your membership will automatically renew unless you cancel it up to four weeks before the contract ends. You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 14â‚¬ through your N26 app.

title: How to cancel my N26 You or N26 Metal membership?
content: N26 You(new tab) orÂ N26 Metal(new tab)Â contracts have a term of one year. This contract automatically renews for another year unless you cancel it. In this article you will find the difference between revocation, cancellation of the membership and cancellation of the renewal of your membership. You have 3 options:Revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation periodCancel your membership at any time up to 1 month before your contract endsStop your membershipâ€™s renewal up to 1 month before it expiresFind in details how to do so below. RevocationYou can revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation period. Simply open a chat with us and we'll assist you from there.Keep in mind that if you cancel your contract before it ends, you wonâ€™t be able to sign up for the same membership plan in the future.Cancel your membership at any time*If you want to terminate your membership at any time up to *1 month before your contract ends and after the 14-day revocation period, please contact us.If you choose this option all your N26 You or N26 Metal benefits will end, which includes your insurance coverage.Stop the renewal of your membership You have up to 4 weeks before your membership expires to cancel the renewal of your N26 You or N26 Metal membership. To do so:Log into the mobile app and go to ğŸ‘¤ My AccountSelect N26 You/MetalTap Membership details followed by Cancel Membership you can also see your membership expiration date hereConfirm the cancellation via the push message we send youYou can continue to use your N26 You or N26 Metal Mastercard fully until your membership expires. That means youâ€™ll keep your insurance coverage as long as youâ€™re still required to pay your membership fee. After that, your Mastercard will work like a standard card without the benefits. Weâ€™ll send you a standard card before your contract ends. No need to contact us about it.Weâ€™ll notify you of the renewal via email 8 weeks before your anniversary date.If you want to definitely close your account, visit our article How to close my N26 account.

title: How to report an insurance claim?
content: YourÂ N26 You(new tab)Â andÂ N26 Metal(new tab)Â membership includes a wide range of insurance benefits, covered by our partner Allianz Global Assistance Europe.*To report a claim, log into your app, go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account and select N26 You/Metal, then select Make a claim.There you'll find:A guide to submit your claim (for example, flight or luggage delay, extended warranty, or travel cancellation)Your account and contract information, including your N26 You or N26 Metal IDThe option to contact Allianz directly in the case of a medical emergencyFor emergencies, please have the following information ready:The full address and telephone number of your current locationNames of all official contacts (doctors, hospitals, and/or police)An exact description of the situation*Allianz Global Assistance Europe is a trading name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and a member of the Allianz Group.

title: How does N26 Business work?
content: â„¹ï¸Â Applies to Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.Itâ€™s not yet possible to switch between accounts so itâ€™s important to know if N26 Business is right for you:The N26 Business account is designed for self-employed and freelance users doing business under their own name. That means you canâ€™t have your companyâ€™s name on the account or card.The N26 Business Mastercard is intended for business use only. You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card. Itâ€™s currently not possible to have two separate N26 accounts at the same time so if you also need a card for private expenses, we recommend ordering a Maestro card (itâ€™s available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).As with the N26 bank account, the account is free and we cover certain cash withdrawals as part of our Fair Use Policy. Unlike other accounts, transfers in foreign currencies arenâ€™t possible with N26 Business within the app. You can visit Transferwise(new tab) for this.Business to business (B2B) payments are not supported with a N26 Business account. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to order my card with express delivery?
content: Express delivery is a good option if you need your card in a hurry or if postal deliveries have sometimes failed to reach you for whatever reason.Youâ€™ll be given the option to select express delivery when choosing a delivery method for your first card or if youÂ reorder a card. Youâ€™ll then receive a tracking link by email. If youâ€™re not home during the delivery and your mailbox canâ€™t be accessed, the card will be left at a nearby access point (you can find it through the provided tracking link). The card only stays at the access point for a limited amount of time. After that, itâ€™ll be returned to us. Weâ€™ll inform you by email if that happens.If you order via express delivery, keep in mind that:Your new Standard, N26 You or Metal Mastercard will be delivered within 2-3 working days. Deliveries take place between 08:00 and 12:00. Deliveries can be made by DHL express to all of our supported countries within Europe. Itâ€™s currently not possible to make deliveries to other countries.Itâ€™s not possible to cancel or change an express delivery once itâ€™s been selected as the delivery method.To close an account, you must pay for the express delivery of your card.If your card hasnâ€™t arrived within 3-5 working days of placing your order, please check the tracking link for an update. You can also use the tracking link to inform DHL directly about the details of your delivery address or to redirect the shipment if you canâ€™t be there at the time of delivery.N26 Standard and N26 You cards have a fee of â‚¬10 for standard shipping and â‚¬30 for express shipping (which includes the â‚¬10 card replacement fee).

title: When will my card arrive?
content: Standard delivery takes up to 15 business days and is free of charge if it's your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership. To stay up-to-date on the delivery progress simply go to the home screen of your N26 mobile app.Express delivery takes up to 3 working days and comes with an additional fee of 20â‚¬. In addition to the banner on the home screen of your N26 mobile app, you will also receive an email with a tracking link to stay up-to-date on the progress of your card delivery. Learn more in our dedicated article about express delivery.Please wait until the estimated delivery time has elapsed before taking further action. Your first card after opening the account or upgrading to a premium membership is always free. For the following ones, a replacement fee may apply.How to make sure your card is on it's way

title: How to activate my card?
content:
Once you receive your physical card, youâ€™ll need to activate it. You can do this in the app only after you connect your smartphone to your account. Or you can activate it directly from the web app(new tab). Youâ€™ll need your 10-digit token number: itâ€™s found below your name on the front of your card (or on the back if you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or Maestro card). To activate your card on the N26 app, from the Home screen:Go to the Actions tab,Select Cards settings and swipe until you see the card you want to activate,Tap Activate.
To activate your card on the web app, just select Activate card from the Home screen.If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia you must make a first ATM withdrawal to fully activate your card.If you have multiple cards (for example, you ordered your card more than once or your delivery was delayed), you can only activate your most recent card. All other cards will be disabled.Youâ€™ll need to follow these activation steps every time you reorder a new card, like if your card is lost, stolen, broken, or you upgrade your account. Â Â After you activate your card, the next step is choosing a card PIN.

title: How to set my card PIN?
content: We donâ€™t send you a PIN via post; you set the PIN for your Mastercard or Maestro cardÂ once youâ€™ve successfully connected your smartphone to your account andÂ activatedÂ your card(s). To set or change your card PIN:Go to the Actions tab.Select Card settings and swipe to choose a card.Select Reset PIN on the mobile or WebApp(new tab).Enter the 10-digit token number on your card.Choose your new PIN and confirm it.Keep in mind that:If you live in France, Spain, Ireland, Greece, Finland, or Estonia, you must make your first payment using Chip and PIN before you can use your card anywhere else. You can also first make a withdrawal or balance inquiry at ATM instead.For security reasons we donâ€™t accept any PIN containing elements of your birth date, address, or any combination of repeated digits or numerical sequences (such as 1111, 1234, or 4321). If the number youâ€™ve chosen is not accepted please try again using a different combination.If a PIN is entered incorrectly three times in a row, the card will automatically be blocked for security reasons. If this happens, please contact our Customer Support via chat so we can unblock it for you.Your card PIN is separate from your Confirmation PIN, however you can choose the same PIN for both.

title: How to change my card limits?
content: You can change yourÂ card PIN, define your daily withdrawal or payment limits enable or disable your ATM withdrawals and online or payments abroad. To do this:SelectÂ 'Actions'Â in the mobile app orÂ WebApp(new tab)Then go to 'Card Settings'Each change you make is applied instantly to all of your cards.You can alsoÂ block your cardÂ or order a new one in case itâ€™s lost or stolen.Prefer a video over text

title: How to block my N26 card?
content: You can block and unblock your cards at any time in the app. Go toÂ the Actions tabÂ and selectÂ Card settings. There you can decide if you want to temporarily limit or disable your ATM withdrawals, online payments or payments abroad, or block your card entirely.This way, you have full control of your card and can protect yourself againstÂ unauthorized transactions. You should immediately block your card if anything looks suspicious. You can always unblock it later.If you do not have access to your N26 mobile app or your N26 webapp login, you can also request to block your card or account by calling us at +44 2035 107126 or +49 303 6428 6881 (both lines in English) .

title: How to use my card digitally?
content: You can make purchases with your smartphone:Simply add your N26 card to your Apple Pay or Google Pay wallet in order to make purchases at merchants who support this payment method.You can enable this feature before your card arrives in the mail to start using your N26 account straight away but also once you have received your card and activated it.To add your card to your wallet follow these steps:Login to your N26 accountGo to 'Actions'Select 'Card Settings' and swipe to select the card you want to addSelect 'Add to Apple Pay' or 'Add to Google Pay'Good to know:Whilst waiting for your card to arrive this feature is available for 30 days after your physical card is being produced. If you don't activate your card within the timeframe then this feature will be suspended. Once you activate your card you will be able to continue using it digitally again.This feature is not enabled if you reorder your card or upgrade to a premium membership without blocking your current card. In these cases your current card will continue working with 'Apple Pay' or 'Google Pay' until you activate your new card.How to view my complete card details in the N26 app

title: Why was I charged an ATM fee?
content: ATM fees could happen for a few reasons: A â‚¬2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our Fair Use Policy. You can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction. Weâ€™ll remind you via push message when youâ€™re running low on free withdrawals. Some ATMs may come with their own fees. This fee will appear within the same transaction in your transaction list, that is added on top of the withdrawal amount. We have no control over these fees and canâ€™t reject or reverse them. Youâ€™ll be informed before the end of a withdrawal if additional fees apply and will have the possibility of cancelling it.Foreign currency ATM withdrawals sometimes include fees. With the N26 account, thereâ€™s a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. This fee is waived for N26 You or N26 Metal members. Using your Maestro for ATM withdrawals. A â‚¬2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. Maestro is only available in Germany, Austria, or the Netherlands. Good to know:To avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the(new tab) Mastercard ATM Locator(new tab) to find free ATMs nearby by selecting no access fee.All ATMs that you can see in the ATM finder support Mastercard.You can find an overview of our plans and fees on our website(new tab).

title: How often can I withdraw cash for free?
content: Cash withdrawals using your Mastercard depend on your T&C country (the address you originally shipped your first card to):Germany:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. You can also use CASH26. Outside of Germany, in the eurozone you receive unlimited free ATM withdrawals in euros.Austria and Italy:Free and unlimited ATM withdrawals (includingÂ CASH26).For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.France, Spain, the Netherlands, and the Rest of Europe:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.N26 You and N26 Business You: 5 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.N26 Metal and N26 Business Metal: 8 free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. Free ATM withdrawals in currencies other than the euro.Switzerland:N26 Standard and N26 Business: 3 to 5* free ATM withdrawals per month in euros. A charge of â‚¬2 applies to each withdrawal beyond this limit. For withdrawals in currencies other than the euro an exchange rate of 1.7% applies.Thereâ€™s always a â‚¬2 fee if you use yourÂ MaestroÂ card to withdraw cash (only available in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands).Check ourÂ pricing listsÂ if youâ€™ve beenÂ charged an ATM fee.*For all countries (except Austria and Italy): You receive 5 free withdrawals during the first three months and after that you will receive 3 free withdrawals. To continue to make use of our 5 free ATM withdrawals a month and stay as a primary account user, you will need to receive regular income paid into your N26 account of at least 1000â‚¬ for two consecutive months. These payments can be 1 or more of the following: Salary, pension, student allowance or government benefits.Any other type of regular payment.Multiple incoming transactions that add up to 1000â‚¬.Please note that we reserve the right to not grant or revoke the primary account user status if the 1000â‚¬ minimum transfer amount is achieved through misuse or you stop receiving these monthly payments.

title: Where can I withdraw cash for free?
content:
Your N26 Mastercard allows you to withdraw cash for free in ATMs from any bank, according to our Fair Use Policy.

However, weâ€™ve been informed that some ATMs from other banks in Spain might charge a fee of around â‚¬2 to those customers who opened their account in a different country. At this time weâ€™re unable to prevent this fee from being charged, but we can help get this money back for you if you contact us via in-app chat.

In the meantime, and in order to avoid complications, hereâ€™s a list of all the banks whose ATMs wonâ€™t charge you such a fee: Evo Banco, Deutsche Bank, Ing, Bankinter, Unicaja, Ibercaja, Liberbank, Triodos Bank, Kutxabank and Cajasur.

Find here more reasons why you couldâ€™ve been charged an ATM fee.

title: How to make a SEPA transfer?
content:
â„¹ï¸ You can send debit transfers to any country within the SEPA zone (if the receiving bank accepts Euros).Outgoing debit transfers can be made in either the N26 app or our Web app.From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Select Send Money followed by Bank Transfer and then â€œadd a new recipientâ€,
Enter the recipient's name and IBAN and select Continue,
Choose the amount and select Next,
Add a message if required or select Skip It,
Check the Transfer Review screen (which sums up the transfer),
Here you can also schedule the date of your transfer and save it as a standing order,
Press send and confirm with your confirmation PIN.Youâ€™ll then need to either Confirm or Cancel the transfer via push notification in the app from your paired device.Once the transfer was confirmed in the mobile app, we can't reverse it or change the recipient's details.If you cannot confirm your debit transfer within the app you need to:Ensure that you have a stable internet connection.Ensure that your mobile phone has push notifications enabled. This is done through the phone settings, not in our app.Ensure that you use your paired device.Once your debit transfer is sent youâ€™ll be able to download a PDF confirmation of it. To do so:Go to your Transactions list.
Locate and select the specific debit transfer.
Scroll down to the Transaction Information and tap PDF by selecting Transfer Confirmation.

title: How to make transfers in foreign currencies?
content: We have partnered with TransferWise to make foreign currency transfers easy. TransferWise offers real-time exchange rates and no hidden fees.To initiate a transfer in a foreign currency start by logging into the mobile app: From the Home screen choose the Actions tabSelect Send Money followed by Foreign Currency TransferSelect the desired currency and enter the amount you would like to send in â‚¬ (it will automatically convert into the foreign currency below). After that, you add a new recipient or select an existing payeeFinalise the transfer with your Confirmation PINIf we donâ€™t currently offer theÂ foreign currency(new tab)Â you need, please visitÂ TransferWise(new tab)Â for more currency options. You can log in by entering your N26 account email and selecting Forgot password

title: How long do transfers take?
content: All domestic and international incoming SEPA transfers are instant if they come from a bank that supports instant transfers and the sender selects this option. Banking regulation applies to SEPA instant transfers and may delay the transfer in case it needs additional monitoring e.g. when sending large amounts of money.In case the sending bank doesnâ€™t offer instant transfers or the sender doesnâ€™t choose this option, all SEPA transfers should arrive within a maximum of 2 working days. Please note that outgoing SEPA transfers are completed within one banking day.If the transfer is not instant, keep in mind that if a transfer has been made right before a weekend or bank holiday, the time frame will be extended. We send our SEPA payment orders through TARGET2(new tab). Itâ€™s open to process payments every working day from 07:00 to 18:00 CET. The system is closed on the following days:1 January (New Year's Day)Good Friday, Easter Monday1 May (Labour Day)25 December (Christmas Day)26 December.WithÂ MoneyBeam, you can transfer money to other N26 customers instantly and you can also receive instant MoneyBeam requests from banks that support instant transfers. Times vary forÂ foreign currency transfersÂ with TransferWise (but youâ€™ll see an estimated transfer time on the quote screen).You'll need to confirm each type of transfer viaÂ push messageÂ in the app before we send anything out.Please note: we only accept transfers in EUR via SEPA (that means no SWIFT transfers).If your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation. We can't investigate incoming transfers.

title: How to save the details of a transfer recipient?
content: Every time you make a transfer to a new recipient in the app (tap + thenÂ TransferÂ andÂ Add new recipient), some details like the recipientâ€™s name and IBAN are automatically saved in your transfer contact list for future transfers. You can also delete contacts or view your transaction history with them:iOS: swipe a contact entry to the left in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Android: tap and hold on a contact entry in order to show the transaction history or delete the entry.Keep in mind that deleting a contact entry doesnâ€™t delete your transaction history with them.

title: Why did my SEPA transfer fail?
content: We acceptÂ transfersÂ in EUR done via SEPA. We don't support SWIFT so if you need to make aÂ foreign currency transfer, please use TransferWise (in the app or from theirÂ website(new tab)).To get a transfer, you'll only need to provide the sender with your full name (as it's written on the ID you provided for verification) and your IBAN.You canÂ find your IBANÂ on your balance statements and inÂ ğŸ‘¤ My AccountÂ (in the mobile app orÂ WebApp(new tab)).Common reasons for failed transfers:The recipient's name on the transfer order is different from the name on their account (must be their name as written on their ID).The recipient's name is a company name instead of a personal/account name (applies to N26 Business).The IBAN is incorrect.You're not receiving the push message to confirm your transfer.An inappropriate use was found. N26 has the responsibility to run routine checks on transactions (seeÂ GwG Â§ 10(new tab)). As a result, we may ask for documentation to verify the origin or source of these transactions. This can result in the credit being delayed or not taking place.

title: Why is my transfer still pending in the N26 app?
content: Youâ€™ll need your Confirmation PIN to finalize all transfers whetherÂ MoneyBeam, standing orders, orÂ CASH26. Your transfer will remain pending until you eitherÂ ConfirmÂ orÂ CancelÂ it via push message in the app.Your Confirmation PIN differs from yourÂ card PINÂ but you can use the same number for both. Youâ€™ll be asked to choose your Confirmation PIN afterÂ connecting your smartphoneÂ (whereas you select a card PIN after activating your card).If you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times in a row, your PIN will be blocked for security reasons. You can restore your PIN byÂ changing itÂ in the app: go toÂ ğŸ‘¤ My AccountÂ then tapÂ SettingsÂ andÂ Security. Then tapÂ Change Confirmation PINÂ (iPhone) orÂ Reset Confirmation PINÂ (Android).

title: How do I return a SEPA transfer to its sender?
content: From the 17th March, customers from other banks can requestâ€”at their bank institutionâ€”the return of a SEPA transfer from an N26 customer.The sender of a SEPA transfer can now request the recall of their funds from the receiving N26 account by reaching out to the sender bank. This request appears to N26 customers in the form of a push notification on their paired device. Similarly to confirming a debit transfer in the N26 app, youâ€™ll then have the option to reject or accept the credit transfer recall.If you do not confirm or reject the transfer recall request after 15 days, the request is rejected automatically. Once the transfer recall is accepted, the funds will leave your account and you cannot request them back. If you donâ€™t have sufficient funds in your Main Account, youâ€™ll not be able to confirm the transfer recall.

title: How long does it take to send money with TransferWise?
content: Once you've initiated your transfer via TransferWise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a TransferWise transfer fails, weâ€™ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with TransferWise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point TransferWise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that TransferWise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with TransferWise this way.TransferWise doesnâ€™t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case TransferWise will deduct this amount from the money returned under theirÂ Conditions of Use(new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipientâ€™s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipientâ€™s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments arenâ€™t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers arenâ€™t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

title: Can I have my pension credited to my N26 account?
content:
N26 Bank GmbH - Sign-ups before 26/03/2020 with German IBANHaving your pension credited to your N26 account is very simple.
This is what you need to do:Fill out online and sign the form provided by INPS;After filling out and signing the form, please send it to support@n26.com via email (please remember to use your registered email account to send the form). We will fill out the rest of the form and send it back to you in a few days.
Please note that you might find references to Citibank N.A in the form. Citibank N.A is an  intermediary bank that credits INPS pensions to bank accounts located abroad. N26 Bank GmbH, Italian Branch - Sign-ups after and including 26/03/2020 with Italian IBANUnfortunately, at the moment it is not possible to receive pension to the N26 account for customers with an Italian IBAN. We will update all our customers and provide additional details and instructions as soon as the service is available.In case you encounter payment delays please contact our Customer Support via chat.

title: How can I credit my salary on my N26 account?
content: Having your salary credited to your N26 account is easy, simply provide your N26 IBAN to your employer, whoâ€™ll transfer the amount to your account via SEPA transfer.SEPA transfers are the official payment method of the SEPA area, which includes most of the European countries. In case your employer refuses to credit your salary through SEPA transfer because you have a German IBAN and not an Italian one, please check the "What to do if my N26 IBAN is not accepted" article on our Support Center.

title: Which foreign exchange rate will I get?
content:
When you use your N26 card to place transactions in foreign currencies, Mastercardâ€™s exchange rates will be applied to the full purchase amount.Good news: N26 doesnâ€™t charge any extra fees for foreign transactions!You can check Mastercardâ€™s rates here: https://www.mastercard.us/en-us/personal/get-support/convert-currency.html(new tab)


You can check the exchange rate and currency markup rate applied to a past transaction on N26 app and website via transaction details on the feed.Please be aware that exchange rates are dynamic, so the transaction value can change until the final purchase amount is charged due to currency variation.

title: Why did my TransferWise account linking fail?
content: We are sorry that you cannot currently link your existing TransferWise account. The most common reason why this could have happened is due to incomplete personal details on your TransferWise account.Â If you have set up an account in the past directly with TransferWise using the same email address as that registered on your N26 account, and you did not fill out all personal details, we will not be able to link your account within N26.Â Please log into your TransferWise account at www.transferwise.com/login(new tab), or via their app, and ensure that your full name, address, date of birth and phone number are complete.Â If you cannot remember your password, go to www.transferwise.com/login(new tab) and select â€˜Forgot passwordâ€™ to reset your password and access your account.If you cannot remember creating an account with TransferWise, you should still try to log in by resetting your password. It could be that it was created via another partner or some time ago.

title: How to create and manage standing orders?
content: When setting up an outgoing transfer in either the N26 app or Web app youâ€™ll have the option to make it a standing order.Once you complete the outgoing transfer you'll then be prompted to tick a box which will create a standing order. After you've inputted the amount of the transfer and its recipient, under the reference text field select "Want to save this as a standing order

title: How to request a refund for a direct debit?
content: You have the ability to request a SEPA direct debit refund in the app yourself up to 8 weeks after it has been debited.Open your transaction list and select the direct debit in question. ChooseÂ Refund. The amount will then be credited to your account within 2 banking days.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. Please check the list of countries:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: Why was I charged a direct debit fee?
content: Direct debits returned to your account due toÂ insufficient funds* are charged a â‚¬3 fee in accordance with ourÂ Terms & Conditions(new tab). If your balance becomes negative due to this fee,Â overdraftÂ interest will also apply at a rate of 8.9%.You can avoid these fees by making sure you have enough funds in your account to cover incoming direct debits by 18:00 on the same business day.We suggest you use SEPA Instant credit transfers, MoneyBeam (between N26 accounts) or CASH26 (if you live in Germany, Austria or Italy) to transfer the amount due. With these three methods, the amount will be credited to your account instantly.If you donâ€™t recognize a direct debit, you can request a refund in the app.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. You can check the list of countries below:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

title: What to do if my N26 IBAN is not accepted?
content: Your IBAN includes the 2 digit country code (e.g. DE), a two-digit check number, the eight-digit bank sort code, and your ten-digit account number. For example:Â DE XX 10011001 26XXXXXXXX.The participating countries of the SEPA area (Single Euro Payments Area) have agreed on the IBAN system in order to simplify national and international payments, and to reduce the risk of error in the communication and processing of transactions.Merchants or employers who do not accept IBANs from other member states of the European Economic Area are violating European law as of 1 February 2016 (Article 9 ofÂ Regulation No 260/2012(new tab)).If you are ever affected by IBAN discrimination, pleaseÂ contact your relevant national authority(new tab) directly and notify them. Provide your contact details, the name of the merchant or company that didnâ€™t accept your IBAN, as well as a brief description of the incident (including a screenshot of the rejection or other documentation of your communication with them).

title: How do contactless payments work?
content: Itâ€™s not possible to deactivate contactless payments. If youâ€™re experiencing issues with your contactless payments, keep in mind that:Â Â To activate contactless payments, you must first use your card at an ATM or payment terminal.Â Transactions up to â‚¬50 donâ€™t require a card PIN*. For amounts over â‚¬50, youâ€™ll need to enter your card PIN.Â *If the merchant's payment system supports this option.Make sure your card is held directly onto an NFC-compatible payment terminal. If you remove your card too fast or didnâ€™t hold it close enough, just try again.Â N26 Metal cards only have NFC on the back side of the card. Make sure to hold the back side of the card against the terminal to use NFC (using the front wonâ€™t work).If contactless is not working, please always try to use the Chip and PIN method to complete your payment.

title: How does 3D Secure work?
content: 3D Secure protects you from online card fraud. Itâ€™s automatically activated when you activate your card in the app. No additional passwords are required.Whenever you make an online payment using your Mastercard, 3D Secure confirms the transaction with you within 5 minutes via aÂ push message. If you don't see the transaction, try some of theÂ troubleshooting tipsÂ we've collected.If you make a purchase using your smartphone, youâ€™ll see a pending transaction in the app. Tap on the bell icon and the push message will appear for you to confirm and finalize your purchase. Then go back to the merchantâ€™s website. You should see a confirmation of your successful purchase within a few moments.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why was I charged more than expected?
content: All transactions take place in real-time. We'll alert you when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens via push message.Sometimes a transaction could look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount for a few reasons:A merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.Changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies.In both cases, we donâ€™t charge interest for the difference in amounts.But if youâ€™re certain that a transaction is unauthorized by you, we could helpÂ get your money back.

title: Where is my refund?
content:
In most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. Scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:On the WebApp(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
On the mobile app: If you're using an iPhone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. A menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement.Â For Androids, you'll find the option under Statistics (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).The amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 12 days.

title: Why did my online purchase fail?
content: Some reasons why your online payment failed:If you are unable to confirm the push message within 5 minutes, simply restart the payment process on the merchant's website.If you do not receive a push message, please make sure that your smartphone is connected and that push messages are enabled on your smartphone.Ensure that online payments and payments abroad are enabled in your card settings.A stable internet connection is required.If you are using an iOS device, make sure you turn off the Do Not Disturb mode.If the amount on the merchant's site is different from the one stated in the push message, this may be due to the conversion of a foreign currency into euros.Make sure that you disable any Adblockers running on your browser.Your Maestro card canâ€™t be used for online purchases.

title: How to rent a car with your N26 card?
content:
In order to rent a car, the main driver is normally required to be a credit card holder, but recently an increasing number of car rental companies have been accepting debit cards due to their growing usage.As a result, our N26 debit card enables you to rent cars at a great number of companies. Here youâ€™ll find some of the agencies that currently accept debit cards:
AlamoAvisCentaurEnterpriseEuropecarFireflyJoy rentLocautoGreaterSicilyByCarThrifty car rentalBefore renting a vehicle, we suggest you contact the company: conditions for the rental depend on the single agencies so requirements may vary locally and nationally.We also recommend checking if the agency accepts debit cards when you reserve the car as well as when you collect it, and whether they require the card to have embossed numbers.Please also consider that:in case an unexpected or unjustified amount is charged, youâ€™ll first need to contact and possibly start a dispute with the agency. Only if the dispute has a negative outcome, weâ€™ll be able to offer our assistance to start a new dispute via Mastercard.the security deposit will be charged (and not authorized, as with credit cards). The deposit will then be credited back to your account after returning the car and if no damage is reported.

title: How to file a complaint?
content:
Looking for support or have a questionIf you don't wish to make a complaint but you have questions about our products or need help with your account, weâ€™re always happy to assist. You can email us at support@n26.com(new tab) (new tab), or just open a chat with us directly within the mobile app or WebApp, that's the fastest and simplest way to get in touch.Raising a complaintWeâ€™re sorry you feel the need to raise a complaint, please see below for the ways you are able to do this.Â If you are dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can send us an email from your registered email address* or send your complaint via post to the address to:N26 Bank GmbH â€“ Complaint Management
KlosterstraÃŸe 62, 10179 Berlin, GermanyTo submit your complaint via email please write to the following email address reclami@n26.com(new tab) (new tab) or through a certified email message (PEC) to reclami@pec.n26.com(new tab) (new tab).Â Alternatively you can request to raise a complaint via our live support team and they will be happy to assist.When filing a complaint, please always include:Your full name email and home addressThe product or service you're unhappy happy withA description of your complaint and when this occurred.Â You can also include any supporting documentation you have in relation to your complaintÂ If the complaint is presented by means of a representative, it must also be accompanied by a special notarized power of attorney form.Weâ€™ll contact you via email to confirm that weâ€™ve received your complaint and then begin our investigation. In case we need more information from you, our Complaint Management department will reach out directly via email with an explanation of the information required.Once our Complaint Management department has investigated your concerns we will provide you with a final decision via email.N26 commits to answer to within:Â 30 calendar days for complaints relating to banking and financial transactions and services;15 working days for complaints regarding payment services such as wire transfers, permanent payment arrangements, debit card charges and more. In the event that it is not possible for us to respect the time limit of 15 days, N26 will send an holding answer indicating the reasons for the delay and the deadline within which the definitive answer will be provided, in any case within the maximum time frame of 35 working days.If you are unhappy with the outcome of your complaintIf you are not satisfied with the resolution provided, you can escalate your complaint to an independent third party.For example:You could file a complaint with the Arbitro Bancario FinanziarioYou could seek to reach an amicable dispute settlement with the assistance of Conciliatore Bancario FinanziarioYou can also go before another entity specialised in amicable settlement of disputes on banking and financial services, as long as this entity is enrolled in the appropriate register kept by the Italian Ministry of JusticeCustomers with a German (DE) IBAN who are not satisfied with the response received to the complaint can also contact one of the following arbitration bodies.For example:An arbitration body is available to you at the German Federal Bank (Deutsche Bundesbank)Or you could file a complaint with the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (Bundesanstalt fÃ¼r Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht â€“ BaFin)Â The European Commission has also set up the Online Dispute Resolution platform to help consumers dispute out of court.We are committed to constantly improving our products and services and your feedback makes this possible. Should you wish to provide us with feedback regarding anything, please write to us at ideas@n26.com(new tab) (new tab).Annual ReportsRendiconto sull'attivitÃ  di gestione dei reclami per l'anno 2019(new tab) (new tab)* We can only discuss account related matters from an email address registered with the N26 account

title: How can I pay bills and top-up my phone from the app?
content: Starting from the 1st of September, it will be possible for all the customers with Italian Terms and Conditions to pay postal bills, PagoPA, MAV / RAV, car tax and top-up their phone directly from their mobile app with the N26 debit card.This service is provided in collaboration with PayTipper SpA, a payment institution that has been a partner of the Enel X group since 2019.How to make payments to 3rd parties within the N26 mobile app:Log in to the N26 app and click on â€œActionsâ€Go to Transfer money and select "Send money"Select "Other payments"In the menu, select the payment you want to make (Phone top-up, PagoPA, Postal bulletins, MAV or RAV, Car tax)You will then be redirected to the website of that service provider and will be able to perform the paymentThe service is not provided directly by N26 but by the 3rd party service providers. For this reason, by using this payment method, you will be subject to the processing of personal data, terms and conditions and any possible commissions not dependent on N26. In some cases the service might be offered only in Italian.If you need assistance with a payment or would like to receive a payment receipt, please get in contact with the customer support of the service provider you have chosen. Click here to get in touch with PayTipper(new tab)Below you can find customer support contacts for the main Italian network providers (please refer to the respective websites for opening hours and service costs):Vodafone: 190Tim: 187Wind Tre: 159Iliad: 177Kena Mobile: 181Ho.Mobile: 19.21.21

title: How to top up my account?
content: Once you are successfully verified, you'll be able to top up your account in several ways. To do so, simply go to the N26 app and select 'Add Money' to see the available options:1. SEPA Transfer (Up to 2 business days):The transfer must be in EUR and within the SEPA zone.You will need to provide your IBAN and your name as it is written on the ID you used to create your account.If you have a Business account, please keep in mind that we do not accept company names.2. Debit or Credit Card (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20â‚¬ and 150â‚¬.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details from the sending account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.3. Apple Pay or Google Pay (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20â‚¬ and 150â‚¬.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3% of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details (credit or debit) linked to the Apple Pay or Google Pay account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.4. Moneybeam (instant):You can receive money from other N26 users.5. CASH26 (instant):Available in Germany, Austria and Italy.Deposit cash through our partner stores once your card is activated and with your paired device.

title: What is the maximum I can spend?
content: The maximumÂ dailyÂ limits (total sum within 24 hours) for card payments are:ATM withdrawals: â‚¬2.500 (or â‚¬400 in Togo, Congo, Benin, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Cameroon, Nigeria, Senegal and Algeria)In-store or online payments: â‚¬5.000You canÂ set your ownÂ daily ATM withdrawal and payment limits within our limits directly in the app by tappingÂ ğŸ‘¤ My AccountÂ thenÂ Card settings.The maximumÂ dailyÂ limits (rolling 24 hours) for bank transfers are:MoneyBeam to N26 customers (the recipient must be visible): â‚¬1.000Outgoing transfers: â‚¬50.000Incoming transfers: No limitThe maximumÂ monthlyÂ limit (total sum) for card transactions refers at any given point in time to the past 30 days and is â‚¬20.000*. *a monthly limit of â‚¬10.000 applies to ATM withdrawals for customers who opened their account in France. Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What if my balance is negative?
content: Your balance can be negative as long as youâ€™re within yourÂ OverdraftÂ limit. If you have a negative account balance, you'll be charged an overdraft interest rate of 8.9%.Otherwise, youâ€™ll receive an email to notify you that the authorized limit of your account has been exceeded. This means you donâ€™t have enough funds on your account to cover future charges.Even if you havenâ€™t used your account since you opened it, certain charges still apply (such as N26 You or N26 Metal monthly fees or express delivery costs) and have resulted in a negative balance.So youâ€™ll need toÂ top up your accountÂ via SEPA transfer (choose international transfer if youâ€™re making the transfer outside of Germany) orÂ CASH26Â (if youâ€™re in Germany or Austria). Your account will remain active for the next 60 days without doing so. At that point:Youâ€™ll receive two additional reminders (each cost â‚¬3).If you have an Overdraft: itâ€™ll be cancelled after the second reminder and youâ€™ll have to repay that amount immediately (or you can set up a repayment plan).If you have an N26 You, N26 Metal, or N26 Business You account: all benefits will be cancelled after 60 days and your account will turn into a standard one.If you donâ€™t respond after 60 days, we may close your account.

title: How to keep track of my daily spending?
content:
We automatically sortÂ your transactionsÂ and display our findings inÂ StatisticsÂ (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your:Categories: We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping). For example, if you send a MoneyBeam with the reference text Lunch, weâ€™ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category. If you feel like a category doesnâ€™t fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.
Hashtags: Weâ€™ve also added default hashtags for transaction times (#weekend), types of transactions (#books), or locations of purchases (#berlin). You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags: tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or remove unwanted tags.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to export a list of my transactions?
content:
OurÂ web app(new tab)Â allows you to search within your transactions. You can also download a history of your transactions in CSV format. To export your transaction list:From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads
Under CSV you can select the Start Date and End Date and Download CSVYou can also sort your transactions usingÂ categories and hashtagsÂ in the app.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:In the web app(new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
In the mobile app: From the Home screen, tap on the three bullet points in the top-right corner of the screen and choose Balance statements.

title: How to use Moneybeam?
content:
MoneyBeam allows you to send money to your smartphoneâ€™s contacts without knowing their bank account details. In order to send a MoneyBeam, log into the app:From the Home screen choose the Actions tab,
Tap Send Money followed by the MoneyBeam option,
Either select a contact from your phoneâ€™s contact list or add a recipient manually, using their phone number or email address. For this to work, the recipient has to be visible as an N26 customer,
Enter the amount and a reference text,
Confirm with your Confirmation PIN and the push message you receive.N26 customers will receive the transfer instantly. You can send up to â‚¬1.000 to other N26 customers within a 24-hour period.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: Why canâ€™t I see other N26 users on MoneyBeam?
content: To carry out real-time transactions such asÂ MoneyBeams, N26 checks your smartphoneâ€™s contact list and finds other N26 users based on saved phone numbers or emails. You can also enter someoneâ€™s contact details manually to send them a MoneyBeam.If you donâ€™t see your friendâ€™s name on MoneyBeam but you know theyâ€™re an N26 user, they most likely havenâ€™t made themselves visible. Indeed you can manage your visibility as an N26 user.Most MoneyBeam transfers that fail between N26 users happen because there are multiple phone numbers or emails listed in the contact entry of a phone's address book. To avoid this, make sure you have the email and phone number your friend uses in your phone book in order to send them MoneyBeams. If the contact details you have stored donâ€™t match, you cannot send a MoneyBeam to your friend.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: What are Shared Spaces?
content: Shared Spaces is a new and easy way for N26 users to share money together. These spaces can be used for anything from splitting bills, to planning a vacation or organising a birthday gift for a friend or relative.Shared Spaces are available to N26 premium users (You / Business You / Metal), who can both create Shared Spaces and invite participants to their Space. Participants can be any N26 account holder regardless of their account type.The owner of the Shared Space owns the money inside it.The owner can invite up to 10 participants and remove participants for their space.Similar to regular Spaces, Shared Spaces have neither an IBAN nor a card attached to them.

title: How does Spaces work?
content: Set goals, create and personalize Spaces, and transfer money between them instantly. Spaces is available in the mobile andÂ WebApp(new tab).In addition to your main account (or primary space), you can create and delete additional Spaces as often as youâ€™d like but the number of active Spaces at any one time depends on your account type: 2 additional Spaces with an N26 or N26 Business account or up to 10 additional Spaces with N26 You, N26 Business You and N26 Metal.Your primary account statements will include all transactions sent to a space or received from one. You can download balance statements from the confirmation page.Only your primary space can be negative (if you are eligible for an overdraft). All other balances in Spaces cannot be negative, meaning you can only transfer what is available in a particular space.You can only use the balance from your primary space toward your Mastercard transactions. So consider transferring money before making a purchase if needed.Move money from one space to another by holding down on your Main Account and dragging and dropping into your space. Once the amount is confirmed the balance is updated right away.You can lock and unlock a space at anytime from your mobile and web app. You'll only need to confirm with your confirmation PIN. If a space is locked, youâ€™ll still be able to transfer money to it. If you need to withdraw money from a locked space, you need first to unlock it.You'll be able to hide the amount within the Space from your account's total balance. Just go into your Space, tap the three dots in the top right corner and select â€˜Hide space balanceâ€™.Spaces includes a feature called Rules which will help you manage your time and your finances effectively.Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to set Rules for Spaces?
content: Within your Spaces, you can set your own Rules! Rules allow you to easily create automated transactions and standing orders to your Spaces to save money and organise your finances.Â If you want to set a Rule through the Web App, hereâ€™s what you need to know:Process a Spaces transfer and then enable the option to repeat the transfer.To delete a Rule, click on the 3 dots indicating the settings. Youâ€™ll see all the active rules. Clicking on the trashcan icon will delete the rule.If you need to change a rule, delete it from the settings of the Space you created the rule in, and then create a new one.If you want to set a Rule through an Android device, you have two options:From Spaces > click on the three dots > create rule > enter amount > select space > choose frequency and date > confirm 2. After setting a Space Transfer > select Repeat > choose frequency and date > confirmÂ If you want to set a Rule through an iOS device, this is what you need to do:Â Â Â Â Â From Spaces > create a new rule > choose frequency and date > confirmÂ Â Please be aware that both Spaces Rules and Standing Orders are processed at the same time of day (0100 UTC). This means if you have a Rule and Standing order set up for the same date, you will need enough funds on that day to cover both.If you have Standing Orders that are dependent on your Rules having happened first, you will need to make sure the Standing Order is set for the day after the Rule. This also means that if you want to prioritise your Standing Orders they need to be set for the day before your Rules.Please note that, if you have an activated Overdraft, a Rule will still be processed automatically even if your balance is negative.

title: Shared Spaces - What is a power of attorney?
content: The legal model behind Shared Spaces is called Power of Attorney (Kontovollmacht in German).Â Participants of a Shared Space do not have equal ownership of the account like a joint account in the traditional banking sense. After receiving Power of Attorney the participants obtain the right to act on behalf of the Owner regarding any transfer of funds within the Shared Space.The person authorizing the other to act on his behalf is called the â€œOwnerâ€, this person is the only account holder. The owner must be a N26 premium account holder e.g. N26 You, N26 Metal and N26 Business You.This means that whoever created the Shared Space is its legal owner. The owner of a Shared Space:Â Owns all the funds within a Shared Space.Â Can transfer funds freely in and out of the account anytime.Â Can invite people to the Shared Space by granting others Power of Attorney.Can revoke the Power of Attorney of a participant at any time.Can also close a Shared Space after removing a participant. (all funds in the Shared Space will be transferred to the Ownerâ€™s Main Account)By granting a person Power of Attorney, theyâ€™ll have full access to all the money held within a Shared Space. This means that each participant can also transfer funds freely in and out of the Shared Space.Â N26 Bank GmbH cannot be held liable for payments covered by the Power of Attorney.Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to add or remove Shared Space participants?
content: For an owner to remove a participant from a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.From the â€˜Participantsâ€™ list, tap on the arrow to the right of the relevant participantâ€™s name (iOS). Android users can just simply tap on the participant's name.Tap â€˜revoke power of attorneyâ€™.Â Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap â€˜revoke power of attorneyâ€™.Â Accept an invitation and join a Shared Space:In the Spaces overview, tap the Space with â€˜Pendingâ€™ and the Shared Space icon. Read the Shared Space summary and continue to the Power of Attorney screen.Once youâ€™ve read and understood the information on the Power of Attorney page (the legal screen), tick the box and tap the â€˜Accept power of attorneyâ€™ button.Enter your Confirmation PIN.Confirm the â€˜Accept Power of Attorneyâ€™ push notification on your paired mobile deviceYouâ€™ll need to have enough free Space(s) to accept an invitation to a Shared Space. If not, you can only proceed if you delete other Space(s) to free up â€¦ Space.You must also not have any open Space with the same name or image as the Shared Space. You can only accept the invitation to join a Shared Space once you change the name/image of the other Space(s).To leave a Shared Space:In the Space overview, tap the menu indicated by the 3 dots in the top right.Inside the settings tap on â€˜Exit Shared Spaceâ€™.Confirm the notification on the next screen and tap â€˜Leave the Spaceâ€™.A Shared Space can be created and modified within the N26 app or WebappLearn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to create a Shared Space?
content:
To create a Shared Space:Create a Space and tap it in the Spaces overview.
Tap the + icon in the top right-hand corner of the page.
Read the â€˜Learn moreâ€™ information and tap the â€˜Invite new memberâ€™ button.
Search and select the contact list for the N26 user you wish to invite. If the person you want to invite has an N26 account but doesn't show up in the contact list, we recommend that you ask them to check if they agreed to be visible to others N26 users via the app, in the My Account section > Settings > Personal Setting > Personal Information.
If needed, enter their full name as we have it listed.
Review the information on the Grant power of attorney page (the legal screen). Once youâ€™ve read and agreed to the T&Cs, tick the box and tap the â€˜Accept power of attorneyâ€™ button.
Enter your Confirmation PIN.
Tap on the relevant participant in the list of participants.
Confirm the â€˜Send Inviteâ€™ push notification on your paired mobile device.
Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces

title: How to use Apple Pay?
content:
(Applies to Germany, Austria, France, Italy, Spain, Finland, Ireland, Iceland, Greece, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Portugal, Slovakia, Estonia, Belgium, Poland, Norway, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, and Switzerland)Apple Pay allows you to make payments with your smartphone so you donâ€™t have to carry your Mastercard everywhere.Weâ€™ve made aÂ video(new tab)Â to help you set up your N26 Mastercard with Apple Pay.Some tips to keep in mind:Your iPhone region matches the country where your Mastercard was first shipped to (you can check your region by selecting Settings then General and Language & Region in your phone).
If youâ€™ve lost your iPhone and arenâ€™t able to find it again using Find My iPhone, you can always access your iCloud and remove all Apple Pay devices via the web browser on a Mac or PC. In addition, you should turn on Lost Mode to block your Mastercard for Apple Pay. Payments with your physical card will still be possible.
If your N26 Mastercard is unexpectedly removed from Apple Wallet, it may be because you have logged out of your iCloud, turned off Passcode or Touch ID, reset your device to factory settings via iTunes, or deleted all the content and settings from your device. In all cases, you can simply add your card again. Keep in mind that the card wonâ€™t be removed if you update your operating system, reset your personal device settings, or turn off Find My iPhone.
For in-store or online purchases, you must authorize your payment via Touch ID or using your passcode. If youâ€™re using Apple Watch, authorizations are done by double-clicking on the side button. And if youâ€™re using your Mac, authorize your payment by using Touch ID via the Touch Bar in the top-right corner of your keyboard.
If you're an N26 Metal or N26 Business You customer, it may happen that the card image displayed in your Apple Wallet shows as an N26 You card (for Metal customers) or as an N26 Business card (for Business You customers). We're working now to resolve this. Rest assured that this does not affect the usability of Apple Pay or your premium membership.
Make sure your device meets the technical requirements by visiting Apple Support(new tab):iPhone 6 or later, iPhone SE: available in apps, stores and webApple Watch paired with iPhone 5 or later: available in apps and storesiPad Pro, iPad Air 2, iPad mini 3, iPad mini 4: available in apps and webMacs introduced in 2012 or later (Macs other than the MacBook Pro with Touch Bar and Touch ID require an iPhone or Apple Watch: available in web

title: How to use Google Pay?
content: Applies to Germany, Spain, Italy, Ireland, Belgium, Slovakia, France, Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Poland and Switzerland. Google Pay is a payment method that allows you to pay with your smartphone so you donâ€™t have to carry your Mastercard with you all the time.Google Pay is available in all shops supporting contactless (NFC) payments as well as online shops. Hold your smartphone near the contactless terminal and your payment will automatically process. When paying online, select Google Pay as the payment option. Weâ€™ll ask you to confirm your payment viaÂ push messageÂ during checkout.Some tips to keep in mind:To add your N26 Mastercard, download the Google Pay app and select Get Started to enter your card details. Youâ€™ll need Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or higher as well as an NFC-capable smartphone.Google Pay requires a screen lock. If you didnâ€™t set it up yet, youâ€™ll be asked to before adding your Mastercard to the Google Pay app.If youâ€™re protecting your smartphone with a case, you might have to remove it to pay. Some payment terminals donâ€™t recognize your phone if the case is too big.If the payment terminal asks you to present your card (again), you might have removed the smartphone too fast or didnâ€™t hold it close enough. Just try again while keeping this in mind.

title: How to earn money by inviting friends to N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account (in the app or theÂ Web app(new tab)).To know the amount you can get per referral, simply access the Refer friends section:Log into the N26 app.From the Home screen, go to the Explore tab (mobile app) or My account ğŸ‘¤ (N26 Web app).Select Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it and select one of the options available for sharing.Optionally, you can write a message to your friend or use the default. Tap Send!To receive your reward your friend must meet all our requirements:Complete their sign up using your referral link or personal code.Activate their Mastercard.Complete a first Mastercard transaction worth at least the value of the referral reward (in-store, online or ATM).Once your friend has fulfilled the requirements, you'll receive the bonus within 60 days.Â You can check the status of your referral bonus in the mobile app or N26 Web.In total,  you can get up to â‚¬1500 out of referrals.If your referral bonus hasnâ€™t arrived yet, weâ€™ve also collected aÂ few reasons why.*The link does not expire and it can be used at any time. Personal invite codes and links should only be used for personal and non-commercial purposes. This means you can share your invite link with your personal connections via social media as long as you are the primary content owner. N26 has the right to cancel the referral program at any time.Currently,Â Friend referralÂ rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.You can find more information in the Refer a Friend ProgramÂ T&Cs(new tab).

title: How to invite friends to join N26?
content: You can start inviting friends as soon as you have access to your account, in the mobile app orÂ N26 WebApp.(new tab) To invite friends:on iOS:Log into the mobile app and tap on the Explore tab next to the + button.Tap on Refer friends.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Select one of the options available for sharing. Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.on Android:Log into the mobile app, then go to My Account ğŸ‘¤ and select the gift icon.Tap on your Referral Code to copy it.Tap Tell a friend.Select one of the options available for sharing.Write a message to your friend or use the default then tap Send.Find out how you can be rewarded for your referrals with ourÂ Refer a Friend ProgramÂ (available in select countries).

title: Why hasn't my referral bonus arrived?
content: Once your friend has completed all the eligibility criteria of ourÂ Refer a Friend Program, we'll verify your reward. You can always sign in to your account in the app orÂ WebApp(new tab)Â to check your reward status.In most cases the referral bonus isnâ€™t rewarded because the invited friend hasnâ€™t made a first Mastercard transaction of 15 EUR. Please make sure to inform your friend of these requirements.Keep in mind that the reward process could take up to 60 days.N26 retains the right to withhold a reward in case of suspicious activity that violates theÂ Terms and Conditions(new tab).Currently, Friend referral rewards are only available for customers in Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain, Belgium, Luxembourg, Greece, Portugal, Ireland, the Netherlands, Finland, Estonia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Norway, Denmark, Poland, Iceland and Liechtenstein.

title: Can I download the N26 app on my smartphone?
content: You can check and download the last version of the N26 app from the AppleÂ App Store(new tab)Â or theÂ Google Play Store(new tab).The minimum requirements for iPhones  (you can find your iOS version under Settings > General > Info):Model 5s or neweriOS 11 or aboveThe minimum requirements for Android (you can find your Android version under Settings > About your device):Android 6.0. or above Want to tell your friends about us and earn some money

title: How to get push messages?
content: We send you push messages to finalize transfers (such asÂ MoneyBeam) or to confirm a service (as withÂ CASH26- please note this is only available in Germany, Austria, Italy). If you arenâ€™t receiving these messages, first check that notifications are enabled for both your phone and the app. Then try some of our troubleshooting suggestions, depending on your smartphone:iOS:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Apple App Store and connect your smartphone again.Check whether youâ€™re logged into your N26 app.Make sure messaging for the app has been activated in the general settings of your smartphone.Android:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Google Play Store and connect your smartphone again.Go to your Account settings and activate notification by tapping App settings then Notifications.Huawei and Xiaomi: go to Settings then Advanced settings and Battery settings. Then set N26 as a protected app.OnePlus: select battery optimization then the N26 app and then don't optimize.Oppo: disable battery optimization for the app and lock it in the Recent apps overview.

title: Why are some products and services unavailable to me?
content: We collaborate with many partners. Thatâ€™s why certain products and services require that you meet their requirements as well. The most common reasons why you wouldnâ€™t be eligible for certain products:Expired or unsupported identity documents (for example, certain passports due to a lack of security features).Youâ€™re taxable in the United States. If so, you wonâ€™t be able to use certain invest or savings products. If this is not the case, contact our Customer Support via chat so we can look into your account details. You may need to switch your telephone number if it starts with a North American area code (+1).You proved your identity using PostIdent (in Germany). Weâ€™ll have to reset your account and youâ€™ll have to prove your identity again in order to use certain products and services. If this is the case, weâ€™ll email you about it and find a convenient time for you to do so.The product or service is not yet available in your country.

title: How to give feedback or suggest a new product?
content: We frequently send short surveys to review feedback but participation is voluntary and anonymous. For individual questions or suggestions, you can send us your feedback toÂ ideas@n26.com(new tab). Weâ€™re always grateful if you can take a minute or two to help us get even better.And if you ever feel dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can alsoÂ file a complaint.

title: How to manage my visibility as an N26 user?
content: To grant you access to all our in-app features, N26 matches your contact data with other N26 users.In order to manage your consent to be seen as a N26 user, you can simply go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account in the app and selecting Settings then Personal Settings and Personal information. Then just check or uncheck the box â€œI agree to be identifiable for other users as N26 customerâ€.All of your contacts who have an N26 account set to visible will show up in the in-app contact list. Similarly, youâ€™ll also appear in the list of other N26 customers who have your contact information. Your contact list is not permanently stored by N26 and is only used when accessing the respective N26 feature.Why do I need to be visible to other N26 users

title: How to contact N26?
content:
If you want to reach out, you can open a chat with us directly within the mobile or WebApp, or from certain Support Center(new tab) articles. As an online bank we don't have branches.First of all, make sure you're up-to-date with the newest version of the app. If not, update your app in the Apple App Store(new tab) or the Google Play Store(new tab).When accessing your account from our WebApp(new tab), you can find the chat in the bottom right corner.Â 

Or from your paired smartphone, go to ğŸ‘¤ My Account then Support. Then scroll down and tap Support chat under Get in touch.Â 

Youâ€™ll then see your place in the queue. Keep your Mastercard close by, it's optional but you'll get faster service.Our chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.Please visit this article if you represent a bank or an authority and need to contact N26(new tab).

title: What is CASH26?
content: â„¹ï¸ Applies to German, Austrian and Italian T&CCASH26 allows you to withdraw or deposit cash by creating and showing a barcode at our participating stores. CASH26 is available in:11.918 REWE, Penny, dm, real, Budni, Ludwig, Eckert, ON, Adamâ€™s, OMV, Barbarino or Rossmann locations in Germany,Â 2.019 participating dm, Billa, Merkur, and PENNY Austria locations in AustriaÂ 202 PAM & Panorama and 386 PENNY stores in Italy.You can find your nearest location, including opening times and directions, on the CASH26 map in the appâ€”tap on the Actions tab in the bottom right hand corner of your mobile app and select CASH26.Withdrawals:As soon as you create a withdrawal barcode, the amount will be deducted from your balance. If you change your mind, you can delete the code and the amount will instantly return to your account.If a barcode remains unused, the amount will be returned to your account after 10 minutes.You can withdraw up to â‚¬900 (â‚¬200 per transaction) within 24 hours.Withdrawals are always free.Deposits:Deposits made with CASH26 are available on your account right away.You can deposit up to â‚¬999 (minimum â‚¬50 per deposit) within 24 hours.All CASH26 deposits will come with a fee of 1.5%.You don't need to buy anything in the store to make a withdrawal or deposit cash.Prefer a video over text

title: How to create a barcode for CASH26?
content: â„¹ï¸Â Applies to German, Austrian and Italian T&CTo create a barcode forÂ CASH26:From the Home screen, select the Actions tab.Tap CASH26 and choose whether you want to Deposit cash or Withdraw cash.Enter the amount and your Confirmation PIN.Confirm the transaction via push message.Simply show this barcode to a partner representative and you'll either be given cash on the spot or asked for the cash you wanted to deposit. It can take up to 10 minutes until this change is reflected on your bank balance. If you delete the barcode or don't use it within 10 minutes, itâ€™ll expire and be removed from your transaction list automatically.Prefer a video over text

title: Come aprire un conto N26?
content: Puoi aprire un conto N26 nell'app (sul tuo smartphone) o nella WebApp(nuova tabella) se:hai almeno 18 annisei residente in un paese supportatopossiedi uno smartphone compatibilepossiedi un documento supportato (l'ammissibilitÃ  varia se vivi in Germania(nuova tabella) o al di fuori della Germania(nuova tabella))non sei giÃ  titolare di un conto N26sei in grado di verificare la tua identitÃ  in una delle seguenti lingue: inglese, tedesco, spagnolo, italiano o francese.Ecco come funziona la procedura per l' apertura di un conto bancario N26:Dopo aver confermato il tuo indirizzo e-mail, i tuoi dettagli personali e l'indirizzo di spedizione, seleziona il tipo di conto desiderato. *Â Dimostra la tua identitÃ Â eÂ collega lo smartphoneÂ al tuo nuovo conto.Â Ricarica il conto(nuova tabella)Â tramite bonifico bancario oppure tramite CASH26 (disponibile solo in Austria, Germania o Italia). Dopo alcuni giorni, riceverai la tua N26 MastercardÂ per posta.Per maggiori informazioni, ecco come puoi contattarci.*Â Se soddisfi i nostriÂ criteri minimi di solvibilitÃ , puoi aprire un account N26. In caso contrario, potremmo offrirti unÂ conto N26 Flex (solo in Germania). La decisione viene calcolata attraverso un processo automatico.Vuoi parlare di noi ai tuoi amici e guadagnarci

title: Posso aprire un conto N26 nel mio paese?
