title: Â¿CÃ³mo revocar mi consentimiento para aparecer visible como usuario de N26?
content:
Para procesar las transferencias instantÃ¡neas a travÃ©s de MoneyBeam o utilizar los Espacios Compartidos, N26 asocia tu informaciÃ³n de contacto con otros usuarios de N26.Ser visible para los demÃ¡s usuarios de N26 te permite utilizar todas las funciones de la cuenta, como por ejemplo MoneyBeam, con la que puedes enviar dinero a tiempo real sin necesidad de introducir un IBAN y solo seleccionando un contacto de tu lista. AdemÃ¡s, tambiÃ©n puedes solicitar a un contacto que te envÃ­e dinero y este puede aceptar o rechazar tu peticiÃ³n. Tener la visibilidad activa, tambiÃ©n te permite utilizar los Espacios Compartidos con alguien que elijas de tu lista.En este artÃ­culo te explicamos como aparecer visible para otros usuarios de N26. Si aceptas aparecer visible como usuario de N26, todos los contactos guardados en tu mÃ³vil que tengan una cuenta N26, aparecerÃ¡n en la lista de contactos de la app N26. De igual modo, tÃº aparecerÃ¡s junto a tu nombre en la lista de otros usuarios de N26 que tengan tu contacto guardado. N26 no almacena tu lista de contactos permanentemente y solo accede a ella cuando utilizas la funciÃ³n MoneyBeam. Cuando se hace un MoneyBeam, solo el emisor y el destinatario pueden ver los detalles de la otra persona (nombre, email o telÃ©fono, concepto e importe de la transferencia). Al emisor, el nombre del destinatario le aparecerÃ¡ tal y como lo tenga guardado en su mÃ³vil. Al destinatario, el nombre del emisor le aparecerÃ¡ tal y como estÃ¡ registrado en N26. 
 
Para aparecer visible como usuario de N26 ante otros usuarios, puedes hacerlo fÃ¡cilmente yendo a ğŸ‘¤ Mi cuenta dentro de la app del mÃ³vil y luego Configuraciones > ConfiguraciÃ³n personal > InformaciÃ³n personal. Una vez ahÃ­, marca la casilla que dice: â€œComo cliente de N26, estoy de acuerdo con ser visible ante otros clientes de N26â€. Â¡Y ya estÃ¡!

title: How do I open an N26 account?
content: Opening an N26 account is easy and can be done in 5 minutes. Think banking canâ€™t be fast, flexible, and transparent

title: How much does an N26 account cost?
content: Your N26 account comes with no minimum balance fees and no account maintenance fees. For further details, please check out yourÂ Consumer Account Agreement and Disclosures(new tab).All fee amounts will be automatically withdrawn from your account, except where prohibited by law. Any time your remaining balance is less than the fee amount being assessed, the balance of your account will be applied to the fee amount, resulting in a negative balance on your account.

title: Can I use the same email address for my U.S. and European N26 accounts?
content: No. For security purposes, you must have a unique email address linked to each N26 account. When signing up for your U.S. N26 account, please select a different email address than the one used for your European N26 account.Additionally, in order to sign-up for a U.S. N26 account you must be a U.S. citizen or a U.S. permanent resident.

title: How do I change my personal data?
content: Itâ€™s important to keep your N26 personal data up to date (for example, your mobile phone number is necessary to connect your smartphone). Here's how you can change your information in our mobile application:Shipping address:Go to ğŸ‘¤ (My Account).Select Settings.Tap on Personal Settings.Make the necessary changes to your shipping address.Account password:Go to ğŸ‘¤ (My Account).Select Settings.Select Security.Tap on Change login Password.Make the necessary changes to your login information.Email address or other personal information (DOB, etc): Please contact us via chat orÂ phone at 1-888-626-0626 as we need to verify your identity. We do not change this personal data via email. This is to ensure your security.

title: How do I find my account number?
content:
You can find your routing and account number:     Â·  On your balance statement or,      Â·Â Â In the ğŸ‘¤ My Account section of the mobile application or web application.Â This information can easily be shared with trusted individuals by:1.  Tapping on the stacked page icon to the right of your name on the web application, or
to the right of your account number in the mobile application.2.  Pasting that information in either a text message, email, document, or spreadsheet.You can also download your balance statements(new tab) from both the mobile and web applications, and copy your account information to the clipboard.Safety Alert: It is not advisable to share your routing and
account number with individuals you do not trust.

title: How can I download my Monthly Statements?
content: OurÂ WebApp(new tab)Â allows you to search for and sort (via categories and hashtags) your transactions. You can also download your bank statements in PDF format via both the WebApp and mobile application.In the WebApp:From the Home page click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads.Select the balance statement that you wish to download as a PDF.In the mobile application:Tap on the Statistics feature (the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).Tap on Balance Statements. Select the balance statement that you wish to download as a PDF.Tap on the Share icon (the square with the arrow in the upper-right corner). Tap on the recipient with whom you would like to share the statement or the method by which you would like to download the PDF (message, email, etc).

title: How can I keep track of my daily spending?
content: To make it easier for you to stay on top of your daily spending, we automatically sort your transactions(new tab) and display our findings in our Statistics feature. We do this by sorting your:Categories:We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve the way we sort transactions into categories such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping. For example, if you send a transfer with the reference text Lunch, weâ€™ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category.Hashtags(#):There are  default hashtags for:Transaction times (#weekend)Types of transactions (#books)Locations of purchases (#newyork)You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags:Tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or to remove unwanted tags.You can access the Statistics feature in the N26 mobile application by either:1. Tapping on the Statistics icon on the home screen.or2. Tapping the bullet point icon in the top right-hand corner of the home screen, then tapping Statistics.Please note that we are constantly adding new features to our mobile application. If you do not see a feature that we describe here, please make sure you are using the latest version of our application by visiting the App Store or Google Play.

title: How do I close my N26 account?
content: To close your N26 account, please contact us at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or via chat in our mobile application or WebApp(new tab) and we'll help you take care of it.A few tips to help speed up the account closure process:In order to close your account, your balance must be zero.Accounts with a positive balance: If you have a positive balance in your main account or in Spaces(new tab), you have a few options to take your balance to zero. Please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out to us if you need help with any of these options. Please note that direct transfers and/or withdrawals cannot be made directly out of Spaces. Any balance in your Spaces must first be moved into your main account for it to be accessible. If you have a balance in a denomination that you can withdraw from an ATM, you can easily take your balance to zero this way (please see our article â€œAll about Allpoint(new tab)â€ for more information).You can use your N26 debit card to make a purchase that will take your balance to zero.You can use a third-party payment processor (PayPal, for example) and transfer your remaining balance. You can transfer your balance to an external bank account. This can be done by initiating a withdrawal by the external bank from your N26 account. Please see our article â€œHow to add money to my N26 account(new tab)â€ to learn more about linking an external bank account to your N26 account. Please note that the transfer must be initiated at the external bank account. We do not currently offer the ability to transfer funds from your N26 account to an external bank account from within our mobile or web applications. Accounts with negative balance: If you have a negative balance, please add funds to bring your balance to $0. Please see our article â€œHow to add money to my N26 account

title: When will my card arrive?
content:
Your card is immediately produced and processed for shipment once you have successfully completed theÂ N26 account sign-up process.(new tab)Â It will be sent via USPS and delivery can
take up to 5-7 business days.Â You can check on the status of your card in the N26 mobile application. To do so:Log into the N26 mobile application.On the Home screen, you can see the status of your card (Ordered/Shipped/Received) as well as an estimate of when your card should arrive.Â Â If you need to change your address after you have finished the account sign-up process, you will need to order a new card. Our customer support team is available via chat or phone to assist you with this.If you need to replace your card for any reason except card expiration, you can do so through the N26 mobile application(new tab)Â or by contacting our customer support team(new tab).Tips for successful delivery of your card:Make sure to enter a residential address (we do not send cards to business addresses, P.O. boxes, or US territories).Do not include any spaces when entering the zip code for your delivery address.Make sure you include important delivery information (for example, your apartment number, the name on your mailbox).If you are staying somewhere temporarily (with a friend or in an Airbnb), make sure to include the name on the mailbox that belongs to the main tenant of the apartment.

title: What if my card is lost?
content: If your card has been lost (or stolen or damaged), you can block the card immediately and order a new one from within the N26 mobile application. To do so:Launch the N26 mobile application.Tap the "Actions" button.Â Tap "Cards Settings".Tap "Order a new card".Select the reason that you are ordering a new card. Please note that selecting a, b, or d will immediately lock your current cardÂ permanently. Selecting "My card is broken" will still allow you to use your card to conduct online transactions.a. "My card got stolen."b. "I lost my card."c. "My card is broken."d. "Other."Tap "Continue" when ready.Â Follow the screen guides to complete your new card order.Â Please make sure to review all of your transactions to ensure that nothing is unauthorized. If you come across any transactions that you do not recognize, please contact customer support as soon as possible. If you've never activated your card, please contact us so that we can order a card for you. You can reach us by phone at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat in our mobile application or via theÂ WebApp.(new tab)

title: How do I activate my debit card?
content: Please keep in mind that:You need to physically have your debit card in order to activate it. Youâ€™ll need your 10-digit token number for this: itâ€™s found below your name on the front of your debit card. Weâ€™ll ask you for this number every time you contact us to prove itâ€™s really you.If you have multiple debit cards (for example, you ordered your card more than once or your delivery was delayed), you can only activate your most recent debit card. All other debit cards will be disabled. This is because you can only have one card per account.Youâ€™ll need to follow the activation steps below every time you activate a new or replacement debit card.Activate your debit card through the mobile app:Log into your account.  Then go to:  "Actions"â†’"Card Settings"â†’"Activate".You will need to enter your token number (below your name). Activate your card through the web app:Log into your account.  The option to activate the debit card will be seen as a banner on the home page.  You will need to enter your token number (below your name).After youâ€™ve activated your debit card, the next step is choosing a card PIN.

title: How do I set my card PIN?
content: PINs are not sent via mail; you can set the PIN for your N26 VisaÂ®Â Debit Card once youâ€™ve successfully paired your smartphone to your account and activated your card. To create or change your card PIN:In the mobile app:Log in and tap on "Actions".Tap on "Card Settings".Tap on "Reset PIN".On the web:Go to ğŸ‘¤ "My Account".Select "Cards".Select "Reset PIN".Keep in mind that:For security reasons we donâ€™t accept any PIN containing repeated digits or numerical sequences (such as 1111, 1234, or 4321). If the number youâ€™ve chosen is not accepted please try again using a different combination.Your card PIN is separate from your Confirmation PIN, however you can choose the same PIN for both.

title: How can I lock and unlock my N26 card?
content: You can lock and unlock your debit card at any time in our mobile application. Log into the application.Tap on "Actions".Select â€œCard settingsâ€. Decide if you want to temporarily:Limit or disable your ATM withdrawals.Disable your online payments.Disable your payments abroad.Lock your debit card.With N26, you have full control of your debit card and can protect yourself against unauthorized transactions. You should immediately lock your card if anything looks suspicious, you can always unlock it later by enabling the settings mentioned above.

title: How do I change my card limits?
content: Debit card limits are used to protect an account from fraud and are typically withdrawal or payment limits.  The overall maximum debit card limits are shown below and are set by N26 .  Lower debit card limit amounts can be set by you, the account holder.Point of Sale (POS) Daily:  $5,000ATM Daily:  $1,500Maximum Cumulative 30-day Limit (cumulative total of all POS, ATM and other withdrawals every 30-day period): $30,000Please note that:  Limits canâ€™t be raised above the maximum.Â To set or change your daily withdrawal or payment limits simply:Log into the mobile application.Tap on "Actions".Tap on "Card Settings".Tap on "Daily Limits".Use the sliders to set your desired daily withdrawal and payment limits.These limits will then be applied instantly to your N26 debit card.

title: How do I add money to my N26 account?
content: We make it easy to fund your N26 account. You can add money via several methods, including direct deposit, transfer from external bank, andÂ debit card transfer, to name a few. Please see below for more information. Direct Deposit:Â If you intend to fund your account via direct deposit, you have a few options.Simply provide the sender (your employer, financial institution, Armed Forces, Social Security, etc.) with our ABA routing number (122287675) and your personal N26 account number.Â You can locate your account number by clicking on the â€œMy Accountâ€ option on the top right side of the website (and the mobile application) after logging into your N26 account.You can fill out a direct deposit form directly in the N26 mobile application and print it or share it electronically. Find out how here(new tab).In case your employer needs a physical direct deposit form, you can download one from our Support Center here(new tab).Transfer From External Bank:Â Transfer funds from your external bank into your N26 account, conveniently, from within the N26 mobile application. To transfer funds to your N26 account using the N26 mobile application, follow these steps (Note: If you have not yet linked an external bank to your N26 account, please read our article "Transfer from External Bank(new tab)â€ to find out how):Launch your N26 mobile application.Tap the "Actions" button at the bottom right of your mobile's screen.Tap on "Add Money".Tap "External bank transfer".Select the account to use to transfer funds from.Enter the amount you want to transfer.Tap "Continue".Enter your 4-digit Confirmation PIN.Tap "Confirm transfer" to initiate the transfer.A message will be displayed in your Transaction List indicating that the transfer is scheduled.ACH transfer:  Transfer funds directly from your primary bank account into your N26 account with an ACH Transfer. (Note: This method is different from Transfer from External Bank in that you will initiate the transfer from your third-partyÂ bank account. This funding method may be a good option if you were unable to set up Transfer from External Bank successfully.)Log into your financial institution's online banking platform or mobile app (if applicable).Locate the â€œExternal Transfersâ€ or â€œTransfer Moneyâ€ or â€œExternal Accountâ€ or similar option and add your N26 checking account as a new account. (The bank account originating the transfer does not have to be under your name. However, please make sure that the recipientâ€™s name is your full name as entered during the account sign-up process).Input our ABA routing number (122287675) and your personal checking account number. (You can locate your account number by clicking on the â€œMy Accountâ€ option on the top right side of the website or by clicking the icon in the mobile app, after logging into your N26 account).Your financial institution may make a small test deposit(s) into your N26 account, within a few days, to verify your account. Typically, to complete the process, you may have to confirm the test deposit(s) with the originating financial institution.Upon completing the initial process, you should be able to transfer funds in or out of your N26 account using the third party banks fund transfer feature.Â Note:Â Please be advised that these are general guidelines and your financial institutionâ€™s requirements may differ.Some banks may experience issues processing money transfers to the routing number 122287675. At this time, ACH bank transfers from Capital One and from USAA are not available to fund your N26 account. If you encounter this issue, please use another bank account to transfer money into your N26 account.Top-Up:Â You can use a debit card (via manual entry, Apple PayÂ®, or Google PayÂ®) to instantly fund your account right from the N26 mobile application.Â This is the fastest way to add money to your N26 account.Â We charge no fees for your first transfer by this method, but we do charge a fee for subsequent such transfers. In addition, if the account associated with the funding debit card contains funds insufficient to cover the transfer, the debit cardâ€™s issuing bank may charge you an overdraft fee or decline the transaction.Â You can find out more about Top-Up here(new tab).MoneyBeam:  Instantly send money to (or receive money from) other N26 members. Find additional details in our "What is MoneyBeam

title: How long do transfers take?
content: All incoming ACH payments are completed within one banking day. Due to the opening times of the participating banks, one banking day may stretch over two working days.If your incoming transfer is outside of these estimated time frames, please contact the sender (bank) for a payment investigation as we cannot track incoming transfers.Related Topics"Why hasnâ€™t my money arrived

title: How can I keep track of my daily spending?
content: To make it easier for you to stay on top of your daily spending, we automatically sort your transactions(new tab) and display our findings in our Statistics feature. We do this by sorting your:Categories:We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve the way we sort transactions into categories such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping. For example, if you send a transfer with the reference text Lunch, weâ€™ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category.Hashtags(#):There are  default hashtags for:Transaction times (#weekend)Types of transactions (#books)Locations of purchases (#newyork)You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags:Tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or to remove unwanted tags.You can access the Statistics feature in the N26 mobile application by either:1. Tapping on the Statistics icon on the home screen.or2. Tapping the bullet point icon in the top right-hand corner of the home screen, then tapping Statistics.Please note that we are constantly adding new features to our mobile application. If you do not see a feature that we describe here, please make sure you are using the latest version of our application by visiting the App Store or Google Play.

title: What is the maximum I can spend?
content: We have limits for bank transactions and debit card transactions.Maximum Daily Limits (total sum within 24 hours):POS:  Daily: $5,000ATM:  Daily: $1,500ACH:  No limits for incoming credits or debitsMaximum Cumulative 30-day Limit (cumulative total of all POS, ATM and other withdrawals every 30-day period): $30,000Limits can NOT be raised above the maximum.These limits are in place to protect the account from potential fraudulent activity.You can customize your daily ATM withdrawal and payment limits directly in the N26 mobile application by:Logging into the mobile application.Tapping on the "Actions" icon in the lower right-hand corner of the screen.Tapping on "Card Settings" under the "Manage" menu.Tapping on "Limits" under the "Settings" menu.Adjusting the "Daily Withdrawal Limit" and/or "Daily Payment Limit" sliders.

title: Why did my online purchase fail?
content: An online payment can fail for several reasons. Here are some of the most common reasons:Your account is low on funds. Donâ€™t forget to check your balance before making an online purchase. Your balance must be greater than the total purchase amount.The card settings in the mobile application donâ€™t allow online payments. We recommend that you check your card settings in your N26 application before making an online purchase. To do this:Log into the mobile application.Tap on â€œActionsâ€.Tap on "Card Settings."Ensure that the toggle button is set to enable â€œOnline paymentsâ€.You have set the limit on your card to be too low. Log into the mobile application.Tap on "Actions".Tap on â€œCard settingsâ€.Tap on â€œLimitsâ€. Check the â€œDaily Payment Limitâ€ on your card and adjust it if necessary.Â Note: This limit cannot be raised above $5,000/day. There is also a maximum cumulative 30-day limit (cumulative total of all POS, ATM and other withdrawals every 30-day period) of $30,000.You made a purchase on a website that doesnâ€™t accept debit cards. Check the information provided by the website itself. It might only accept credit cards and not debit cards. If that is the case, you will not be able to use your N26 Visa card.

title: What if I have a negative balance?
content: You are not permitted to overdraw your N26 account. Â If the available balance in your account is not sufficient to cover a payment you have authorized, that payment will be rejected.  However, your account balance may go negative in cases of technical overdraft - this occurs when you don't have enough money in your account to cover certain N26 account fees, such as a card replacement fee.If your account balance does become negative, you must immediately make a deposit to cover the negative balance.  For information on how to make a deposit to your account, please see â€œHow to Add Money to My N26 Account(new tab)â€.

title: How do I get cash?
content: You can get cash at any convenient ATM, but you may have to pay a fee to do so. We have partnered with the Allpoint ATM Network to provide you with unlimitedÂ freeÂ ATM withdrawals at over 55,000 locations across the US, Canada, Puerto Rico, Australia, Mexico, and the UK.With access to an expansive retail network including Target, Walgreens, CVS, Speedway, and Kroger, you'll never need to pay to withdraw cash again! You can quickly and easily locate Allpoint ATMs via the ATM Map feature in our mobile application for iOS and Android. Find more information about this convenient feature here! Not on your smartphone

title: Will my direct debit go through if I am low on funds?
content: If your account has insufficient funds when a direct debit is due, it will simply be declined. It is not possible to delay a direct debit. Please note, your account will not be charged an insufficient funds fee.

title: Why was I charged more than expected?
content: All debit card transactions take place in real-time. We'll alert you via push notification when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens .Sometimes a transaction can look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount. This can be because:A merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.Changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies.If the transaction was not authorized by you, we're happy to help.  Either call us at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat with us and weâ€™ll be happy to help you.

title: Is there a fee if I make a purchase while I am abroad?
content: No, N26 does not charge you a fee for purchases made while you are abroad, but we do apply the current conversion rate. You can use Visaâ€™s currency converter(new tab) to get an indication of the rate you may receive when using your N26 Visa debit card. Please note that this is only an indication, not a guarantee, and is therefore subject to change. Please also note that international ATM transactions may incur other fees as disclosed in your Consumer Account Agreement and Disclosures(new tab).

title: Why can't I use my card in certain countries?
content: Certain countries are sanctioned by the U.S. Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control ("OFAC"), and your N26 debit card cannot be used in those OFAC-sanctioned regions. More information about OFAC can be found on the U.S Treasury's website.(new tab)

title: Can I download the N26 app on my smartphone?
content: The latest version of the N26 app can be downloaded from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. Please be aware, there are minimum requirements for all phones to ensure proper usage.  Those requirements are listed below:iPhone:Model 5s or neweriOS 11 or above (You can find your iOS version under â€œMy Account">"Settings">"App Settingsâ€)Android:5.0 or above (You can find your Android version under â€œSettings">"About Your Deviceâ€)Native support of Google Services.Â

title: How do I enable Push Notifications?
content: We send you push messages to finalize transfers (with MoneyBeam, for example). If you arenâ€™t receiving these messages, first check that notifications are enabled for both your phone and the application. If this does not fix the issue, try some of our troubleshooting suggestions, depending on your smartphone:iOS:Unpair yourÂ device ("My Account"â†’"Settings"â†’"Security"â†’"Unpair phone").Uninstall the application.Force restart.iPhone 7 and earlier: Hold the Home button and Power button until the Apple logo appears.iPhone 7 and 7+: Hold Volume button and Power button.iPhone 8 and later:Â Press down and quickly release the Volume Up button, then press down and quickly release the Volume Down button.Â Now press and hold the side Power button and continue holding until you see the Apple logo, then release.Reinstall the application.Re-pair the device/application. Click for more information on this step.Â If you are still not receiving push notifications, please check that notifications are enabled in the settings."iPhone Settings"â†’"Notifications"â†’"N26"â†’"Allow notifications".Android:Unpair yourÂ device ("My account"â†’"Settings"â†’"Security"â†’"Unpair phone").Uninstall the application.Turn offÂ your device for 2 minutes to clear background data.Turn your device onÂ again and reinstallÂ the application.Re-pair your device with the application. Click here for more information on this step.If you are still not receiving notifications, please check the following things:Google Play Services are up to date.Notifications have been enabled in the applications manager as well as in your device's settings.Do-Not-Disturb mode and Power-Save mode are not activated.In "Energy Settings", the N26 application is not set to "Optimized".Your device has 100MB of free storage.On some Android devices, changing key security settings or powering the phone off completely may cause an automatic unpairing. If this has happened, please repeat the pairing process.

title: How do I pair my smartphone to my N26 account?
content: In order to use your N26 account, you will need a compatible phone:iPhone 5s or newer,Android 5.0 or newerOnce you create an account, you will need to pair it with your phone. Only one phone can be paired per account. In order to pair your phone to your account, follow these steps:Open the N26 mobile application on your phone.You will be asked to confirm your phone number.We will send a 4-digit code via SMS to the phone number you provided.Enter the 4-digit code to complete pairing.

title: What are Spaces?
content: Spaces are sub accounts that you can create and personalize. Spaces help you visualize your short- and long-term financial goals by giving you a place to set aside your money and track your progress. You can instantaneously move money between your Spaces accounts as often as you like. ThisÂ feature is available using our mobile applicationÂ and WebApp. See below for more information about how to start using Spaces today!Related Topics"How can I use Spaces

title: How can I invite friends to join N26?
content: You can start inviting friends from the N26 mobile application and web application as soon as you have access to your account. Once your friend successfully opens their N26 account and spends $10, you will get $10 from us and your friend will get $5!To invite friends:On iOS and AndroidLog into your account and tap on the â€œExploreâ€ button.Tap on â€œRefer friendsâ€.Tap on â€œTell a friendâ€. Select one of the options available for sharing.Write a message to your friend or use the default message then tap â€œSendâ€.On the web applicationLog into your account, then go to â€œMy Accountâ€ in the top right-hand corner of the screen. Click on the â€œInvite your friendsâ€ option (next to the gift box icon).After reading the instructions and viewing the terms and conditions, click on â€œStart invitingâ€.You can copy your unique referral code by clicking on it or you can send the referral directly via your preferred sharing method.Related Topics:â€œDoes the link that I sent my friend expire

title: What is MoneyBeam?
content: MoneyBeam is a service that allows you to send money to (or receive money from) other N26 members.How can I send money using MoneyBeam

title: How do I create or reset a password?
content: If you forgot your password or want to change it follow these easy steps:During login, select "Forgot

title: Why didn't I receive my pairing code via SMS?
content: A pairing code is required to connect your smartphone(new tab) to your account. If you didnâ€™t receive this code via SMS for whatever reason, you can request a new one up to five times in the mobile app. Please wait 30 seconds before requesting a new one.If all five codes are requested and pairing is still unsuccessful, for security reasons youâ€™ll be blocked from making further requests for 24 hours. If this happens, you can either wait or contact our Customer Support via phone at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat - and we would be happy to help you.

title: How do I change my Confirmation PIN?
content: You can change your Confirmation PIN at any time in the mobile application or WebApp.In the mobile application:Tap on the My Account icon (â€œ ğŸ‘¤â€)Tap on â€œSettingsâ€.Select â€Securityâ€. Select â€œChange Confirmation PINâ€.Enter the 10-digit token number on your Visa debit card.Create and confirm your new Confirmation PIN.In the WebApp(new tab):Click on â€œ ğŸ‘¤ My Accountâ€.Click on â€Security Settingsâ€. Select â€œChange Confirmation PINâ€.Enter the 10-digit token number on your Visa debit card.Create and confirm your new Confirmation PIN.If you enter your Confirmation PIN incorrectly 6 times, you'll need to wait 24 hours before trying again.Please note that, for security reasons, your PIN cannot contain:Parts of your date of birth or your addressRepeated numbers (such as 1111, 111, or 11), or sequences (such as 1234 or 4321). If the PIN youâ€™ve chosen is not accepted, please try again using a different one. If your card was stolen or lost, contact Customer Support immediately by phone at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat through the mobile app or WebApp(new tab).

title: How can I protect my account?
content: The security of your account and your personal data is our top priority.If you ever feel that your N26 login may be compromised or that someone is trying to initiate a chat on your behalf, itâ€™s crucial to immediately change your N26 account password. You can do so via both our mobile and web applications. On the web:Log in and click on â€œMy Accountâ€.Click on â€œSecurity Settingsâ€. Enter your current password and enter a new secure password(new tab). Please donâ€™t reveal your login details to anyone. Click on â€œSet new passwordâ€.In the mobile application:Log in and go to â€œMy Account" > "Settings" > "Securityâ€. Tap on â€œChange login Passwordâ€. Please choose a secure password(new tab). Please donâ€™t reveal your login details to anyone.It is important to remember that, as the account holder, you and only you should create and have access to your login details.  If you believe that your account has been compromised or tampered with in any way, you can get in touch with us immediately by phone at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat with us directly from the N26 mobile application or WebApp(new tab).

title: How can I protect my identity?
content: To protect and help avoid the misuse of your personal data, please keep in mind that:We will never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. This includes verifications for apartment rental contracts, lines of credit, or job offers (including jobs with N26). Only complete the verification process if you want to open an N26 account for yourself.As the account owner, only you should create and have access to your login credentials. Never create an N26 account with a predefined email address and password. If you use login credentials that were given to you, these credentials may be used to reach your personal and legal information. Also, never log into an N26 account that is not yours.Do not send your Social Security Number to unknown or unverified recipients.We may ask for certain documents when your transaction is subject to a routine check. Only send valid documentation to verified N26 email accounts.We will never ask for your username, password, or PIN codes outside the N26 app. Never provide this information in an external website or app, even if it looks N26-related.Mail is another easy target for thieves. If you are traveling out of town, it may be a good idea to have your mail held or to consider obtaining a U.S. Postal Service-approved lockable mailbox. All bank statements should be shredded, as well. Take care to monitor your financial statements. Make sure you recognize every transaction, no matter how small. If you received a suspicious request from a third party, or think your N26 login may be compromised, please do not hesitate to contact us(new tab).

title: Why is N26 secure?
content: To protect your account, we use a two-layer security architecture:Secure login. Your login, on both the mobile app and web app(new tab), consists of a username and password or fingerprint/face recognition (depending on your smartphone). Please choose a secure password and do not reveal your login details to anyone.Confirmation PIN. This 4-digit code is required every time you make a transfer or connect/disconnect your phone. It is first set up when you have successfully connected your smartphone to your account, and can then be changed in the application after that. (Note: a Confirmation PIN is not the same as a Card PIN, which is the code you use when you withdraw cash from an ATM with your N26 card.)Every time you contact us, weâ€™ll ask you some security questions to make sure it's really you. But weâ€™ll never ask for your debit card number, card verification code (CVV), password, or your card or Confirmation PIN(s).

title: Are N26 accounts FDIC-insured?
content: Yes - N26 accounts are FDIC-insured through our partner bank, Axos BankÂ®, Member FDIC. This means that deposits in N26 accounts are insured up to $250,000. Please note that all deposit accounts of the same ownership and/or vesting held at Axos BankÂ® are combined and insured under the same FDIC Certificate 35546, and that all deposit accounts through Axos BankÂ® brands are not separately insured by the FDIC from other deposit accounts held with the same ownership and/or vesting at Axos BankÂ®. This means that if you have an Axos BankÂ® account (non-N26) in addition to an N26 account, the total coverage will be $250,000.

title: What steps should I take if I notice a fraudulent transaction on my account?
content: If you donâ€™t recognize a transaction or youâ€™re sure you didnâ€™t authorize it, blocking your debit card wonâ€™t be enough. In these cases you should immediately:Order a new debit card and mark your current one as stolen. Destroy your existing debit card by cutting it with scissors or a shredder. The chip, NFC antenna, and the magnetic strip should all be cut into pieces and disposed of separately.EitherÂ callÂ us at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or chat with us through the N26 app.  Weâ€™ll help you from there and weâ€™ll do our best to get your money back.You can continue using your account for ACH payments until your new debit card arrives.  You should keep in mind that changes in the final amount debited from your account don't necessarily indicate fraud.Please note that in cases of fraud you have up to 60 days to open a dispute with us.

title: How do I dispute a transaction?
content: We can only process disputes for transactions that have settled into your account.  In order to properly process a dispute, we will ask you for details about the charge and the reason for the dispute:Youâ€™ll need to provide all or some of the following information:The full name on the accountThe account numberName of merchantDate of the disputed chargeAmount of the disputed chargeReason for the disputeImportant:  If you believe a charge on your account is the result of fraud, or if you believe that your card has been lost or stolen, please block your card immediately and contact our customer support either by phone or by chat.

title: How do I open an N26 account?
content: Opening an N26 account is easy and can be done in 5 minutes. Think banking canâ€™t be fast, flexible, and transparent

title: How much does an N26 account cost?
content: Your N26 account comes with no minimum balance fees and no account maintenance fees. For further details, please check out yourÂ Consumer Account Agreement and Disclosures(new tab).All fee amounts will be automatically withdrawn from your account, except where prohibited by law. Any time your remaining balance is less than the fee amount being assessed, the balance of your account will be applied to the fee amount, resulting in a negative balance on your account.

title: Can I use the same email address for my U.S. and European N26 accounts?
content: No. For security purposes, you must have a unique email address linked to each N26 account. When signing up for your U.S. N26 account, please select a different email address than the one used for your European N26 account.Additionally, in order to sign-up for a U.S. N26 account you must be a U.S. citizen or a U.S. permanent resident.

title: How do I change my personal data?
content: Itâ€™s important to keep your N26 personal data up to date (for example, your mobile phone number is necessary to connect your smartphone). Here's how you can change your information in our mobile application:Shipping address:Go to ğŸ‘¤ (My Account).Select Settings.Tap on Personal Settings.Make the necessary changes to your shipping address.Account password:Go to ğŸ‘¤ (My Account).Select Settings.Select Security.Tap on Change login Password.Make the necessary changes to your login information.Email address or other personal information (DOB, etc): Please contact us via chat orÂ phone at 1-888-626-0626 as we need to verify your identity. We do not change this personal data via email. This is to ensure your security.

title: How do I find my account number?
content:
You can find your routing and account number:     Â·  On your balance statement or,      Â·Â Â In the ğŸ‘¤ My Account section of the mobile application or web application.Â This information can easily be shared with trusted individuals by:1.  Tapping on the stacked page icon to the right of your name on the web application, or
to the right of your account number in the mobile application.2.  Pasting that information in either a text message, email, document, or spreadsheet.You can also download your balance statements(new tab) from both the mobile and web applications, and copy your account information to the clipboard.Safety Alert: It is not advisable to share your routing and
account number with individuals you do not trust.

title: How can I download my Monthly Statements?
content: OurÂ WebApp(new tab)Â allows you to search for and sort (via categories and hashtags) your transactions. You can also download your bank statements in PDF format via both the WebApp and mobile application.In the WebApp:From the Home page click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads.Select the balance statement that you wish to download as a PDF.In the mobile application:Tap on the Statistics feature (the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).Tap on Balance Statements. Select the balance statement that you wish to download as a PDF.Tap on the Share icon (the square with the arrow in the upper-right corner). Tap on the recipient with whom you would like to share the statement or the method by which you would like to download the PDF (message, email, etc).

title: How can I keep track of my daily spending?
content: To make it easier for you to stay on top of your daily spending, we automatically sort your transactions(new tab) and display our findings in our Statistics feature. We do this by sorting your:Categories:We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve the way we sort transactions into categories such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping. For example, if you send a transfer with the reference text Lunch, weâ€™ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category.Hashtags(#):There are  default hashtags for:Transaction times (#weekend)Types of transactions (#books)Locations of purchases (#newyork)You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags:Tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or to remove unwanted tags.You can access the Statistics feature in the N26 mobile application by either:1. Tapping on the Statistics icon on the home screen.or2. Tapping the bullet point icon in the top right-hand corner of the home screen, then tapping Statistics.Please note that we are constantly adding new features to our mobile application. If you do not see a feature that we describe here, please make sure you are using the latest version of our application by visiting the App Store or Google Play.

title: How do I close my N26 account?
content: To close your N26 account, please contact us at 1-888-N26-0-N26 (1-888-626-0626) or via chat in our mobile application or WebApp(new tab) and we'll help you take care of it.A few tips to help speed up the account closure process:In order to close your account, your balance must be zero.Accounts with a positive balance: If you have a positive balance in your main account or in Spaces(new tab), you have a few options to take your balance to zero. Please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out to us if you need help with any of these options. Please note that direct transfers and/or withdrawals cannot be made directly out of Spaces. Any balance in your Spaces must first be moved into your main account for it to be accessible. If you have a balance in a denomination that you can withdraw from an ATM, you can easily take your balance to zero this way (please see our article â€œAll about Allpoint(new tab)â€ for more information).You can use your N26 debit card to make a purchase that will take your balance to zero.You can use a third-party payment processor (PayPal, for example) and transfer your remaining balance. You can transfer your balance to an external bank account. This can be done by initiating a withdrawal by the external bank from your N26 account. Please see our article â€œHow to add money to my N26 account(new tab)â€ to learn more about linking an external bank account to your N26 account. Please note that the transfer must be initiated at the external bank account. We do not currently offer the ability to transfer funds from your N26 account to an external bank account from within our mobile or web applications. Accounts with negative balance: If you have a negative balance, please add funds to bring your balance to $0. Please see our article â€œHow to add money to my N26 account
